{{About|the format in {{JE}}|the legacy format|Item format/Before 1.20.5|the format in {{BE}}|Item components}}
{{redirect|Component|the text format|Text component format}}{{exclusive|java}}

'''Data components''', or simply '''components''', are structured data used to define and store various properties. They are used on [[item]]s, where they are referred as '''item components''' or '''item stack components''', and [[block entities]], partially replacing [[NBT format]].

Data components are used in various places, including the [[Player.dat format|player's inventory]], container [[Block entity format|block entities]] and [[structure file]]s.

Data components are [[Resource location|namespaced identifiers]], and can be of different data types, see {{slink||List of components}}.

For properties of items that are defined by code and cannot be modified through components, see [[Java Edition hardcoded item properties]].

{{TOC|none|limit=2}}

== Usage ==

=== Command format ===
Data component can be used in the [[Argument types#minecraft:item_stack|item_stack]] and [[Argument types#minecraft:item_predicate|item_predicate]] argument types.

In commands that take an item_stack argument, such as {{command|give}}, items are represented in the format <code>''item_id''[''component1''=''value'',''component2''=''value'']</code>, with ''component'' being the [[resource location]] of a component, and the ''value'' being the value of the component in [[NBT format#SNBT format|SNBT format]]. Components can be removed by prefixing them with an exclamation mark, like <code>item_id[!''component3'']</code>. If no components are specified, the square brackets can be removed, leaving just the item ID. See [[Argument types#minecraft:item_stack|item_stack]] for details.

In commands that take an item_predicate argument, such as {{command|clear}}, items are represented in the format <code>''item_type''[''tests'']</code>, with ''tests'' can be tests of data components or an [[item sub-predicate]]. See [[Argument types#minecraft:item_predicate|item_predicate]] for details.

=== Item format ===
{{for|the legacy format before 1.20.5|Item format/Before 1.20.5}}

Every item type (item ID) has a set of ''default'' data components. Item stacks must specify an item ID, which implicity sets these default components, but they may be overriden by that individual item stack. Default components are not saved on individual item stacks.

When saved in the [[NBT format]], items are written as a compound with the following tags:
<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound}} The root tag. <section begin="item format" /><section begin="item format nocount" />
** {{nbt|string|id}}: The [[resource location]] of the item. Must not be <code>minecraft:air</code>.<section end="item format nocount" />
** {{nbt|int|count}}: Number of [[item]]s stacked in this inventory slot. Any item can be stacked, even if unstackable through normal means. Defaults to 1 if not specified.<section begin="item format nocount" />
** {{nbt|compound|components}}: Optional map of additional (non-default) data components.
*** See {{#ifeq:{{PAGENAME}}|Data component format|the [[#List of components|list of components below]]|[[Data component format]]}}.<section end="item format nocount" /><section end="item format" />
</div>
In containers that do not use the data component format (such as container blocks and entity inventories), an additional {{nbt|byte|Slot}} tag is used to specify the slot the item is in e.g. <code>{Slot:0b,id:"stone"}</code>. This is not a part of the item stack format so is not present anywhere else where individual items are stored (such as single-slot containers, unstructured lists of items, etc.). In the data component format, slot numbers and item stacks are stored as separate fields e.g. <code>{slot:0,item:{id:"stone"}}</code>.

=== Block entity format ===
{{Main|Block entity format}}
Block entities are stored in the [[NBT format]]. While they still use NBT tags for their individual properties, any non-default data components that exist on the item used to place the block will be saved.

Some NBT data on block entities are treated as data components when transfering data between items and blocks. For example, the <code>Items</code> field in a chest is interpreted as the <code>minecraft:container</code> component, despite being labeled and structured differently.

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound}} The root tag.
{{#lst:Block entity format|nbt format}}
** Additional tags depending on the block entity ID. See [[Block entity format]].
</div>

For example, if a <code>chest</code> was given to a player with the components <code>minecraft:custom_data={foo:1}</code> and <code>minecraft:container=[{slot:0,item:{id:"stone"}}]]</code>, then placed the block on the ground, the block will be saved (omitting some fields) as:

<code>{id:"minecraft:chest", Items:[{count:1,id:"minecraft:stone",Slot:0b}], components:{"minecraft:custom_data":{foo:1}}}</code>

with <code>minecraft:container</code> saved as the <code>Items</code> tag, and <code>minecraft:custom_data</code> separated as it is not used by chest block entities.

=== can_break ===

When present, the player holding the item can break the specified blocks in [[Adventure]] mode.
<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
{{/can break}}
</div>
''Example:'' {{command|give @s netherite_pickaxe[can_break{{=}}{blocks:['black_concrete','coal_ore','iron_ore','gold_ore','diamond_ore','emerald_ore']}]}}
* Gives a netherite pickaxe that can only mine some ores, as well as black concrete.

=== can_place_on ===

<div class="treeview">
When present, the player holding the item can place the held block item on any sides of the specified blocks in [[Adventure]] mode.
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
{{/can place on}}
</div>
''Example:'' {{command|give @s target[can_place_on{{=}}{blocks:'sandstone'}]}}
* Gives a target block that can only be placed on sandstone.

=== charged_projectiles ===

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
{{/charged projectiles}}
</div>
''Example:'' {{command|give @s crossbow[charged_projectiles{{=}}[{id:"spectral_arrow"}]]}}
* Gives a crossbow that is already charged with a spectral arrow.
Note: Adding an invalid projectile or item id charges an arrow that, when collected, grants the wrong item. Ex: wind_charge causes it to fire an arrow that grants a wind charge when collected.

=== consumable ===
If present, the item can be consumed. Its options can also be modified. 
* If the item already has an existing right-click functionality (like placing a block), it keeps that functionality. 
* If the {{cd|[[Data component format#food|minecraft:food]]}}, {{cd|[[Data component format#potion_contents|minecraft:potion_contents]]}}, {{cd|[[Data component format#ominous_bottle_amplifier|minecraft:ominous_bottle_amplifier]]}} or {{cd|[[Data component format#suspicious_stew_effects|minecraft:suspicious_stew_effects]]}} components are also present on this item, consuming it applies the stats and effects of those components.
<div class="treeview">

* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
{{/consumable}}</div>
''Example:'' {{command|/give @s gold_ingot[consumable{{=}}{consume_seconds:3.0, animation:'eat', sound:'entity.generic.eat', has_consume_particles:true, on_consume_effects:[{type:'minecraft:clear_all_effects'}]}]}}
* Gives a gold ingot that can be eaten in 3 seconds and upon consuming, clears all effects.

* Gives a bone with custom model data. The <code>colors</code> list shows three possible representations of the same violet color.

=== custom_name ===

Used to specify the item's custom name, like you can in an anvil. 
This component:
* has a higher priority over the {{cd|[[Data component format#item_name|minecraft:item_name]]}} component
* can be renamed or removed using an anvil 
* if unspecified otherwise, the item's name defaults to being italic.
<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
{{/custom name}}
</div>
''Example:'' 
: {{command|give @s stick[custom_name{{=}}{text:"Magic Wand",color:"light_purple",italic:false}]}}
* Gives a stick named "Magic Wand" in light purple non-italicized text.

</div>

=== enchantments === 

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
{{/enchantments}}
</div>
''Example:'' {{command|give @s wooden_sword[enchantments{{=}}{sharpness:3,knockback:2}]}}
* Gives a wooden sword with sharpness III and knockback II.
''Note'': This component adds active enchantments and should not be confused with the [[Data component format#stored enchantments|{{cd|minecraft:stored_enchantments}}]] component, which is used to add inactive enchantments, such as with [[Enchanted Book|enchanted books]]. 

To illustrate the difference, hitting an entity with an {{cd|enchanted_book[enchantments{{=}}{knockback:2}]}} would knock any entity hit per knockback II while hitting an entity with an {{cd|enchanted_book[stored_enchantments{{=}}{knockback:2}]}} would not. 

Furthermore the latter would be able to add knockback II to an enchantable item in an anvil, while the former would not.

''Example:'' {{command|/give @s amethyst_shard[kinetic_weapon{{=}}{forward_movement:0.0,delay_ticks:20,damage_conditions:{max_duration_ticks:60},knockback_conditions:{max_duration_ticks:40},dismount_conditions:{max_duration_ticks:20},hit_sound:"block.amethyst_cluster.step"}]}}
* Gives an amethyst shard which can perform a charge attack after a 1-second delay. The attack can damage entities for 3 seconds, knock them back for the first 2 seconds and dismount them for the first second. Hitting a target with the attack plays an amethyst sound.

=== lock ===

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
{{/lock}}
</div>
''Example 1:'' {{command|give @p chest[minecraft:lock{{=}}{components:{"minecraft:item_model":"minecraft:diamond"<nowiki>}}]</nowiki>}}
* Gives a chest that is locked, opening only if the player is holding an item with the same model as a Diamond.
''Example 2:'' {{command|give @p furnace[minecraft:lock{{=}}{components:{"minecraft:custom_name":"Furnace Key"<nowiki>}}]</nowiki>}}
* Gives a furnace that opens only if the player is holding an item with the custom name "Furnace Key".
''Example 3:'' {{command|give @p barrel[minecraft:lock{{=}}{items:["minecraft:oak_planks","minecraft:diamond"],count:6,predicates:{custom_data:{bar:foo<nowiki>}}</nowiki>}]}}
* Gives a barrel that opens only if the player is holding exactly 6 [[Planks#Oak|oak planks]] or 6 [[diamond]]s that has the custom data {{cd|bar:foo}}

''Example:'' {{command|/give @p ender_pearl[use_cooldown{{=}}{seconds:10,cooldown_group:"foo:bar"}]}}
* Gives an ender pearl that has a 10 second cooldown after being used, and also applies that cooldown to ''any'' item that shares its <code>cooldown_group</code>.
** If other items in the inventory share the same <code>cooldown_group</code>, but have different <code>seconds</code>, then using that item applies the <code>seconds</code> of ''itself'' to all other items in the inventory, rather than each item applying their own <code>seconds</code> to themselves.
* Items can have their cooldowns disabled completely by removing the component with <code>[!use_cooldown]</code>.

== Entity variant components ==
{{work in progress|Add more information about entity variant components (in general)|section=1}}
Entity variant components are a group of components that are present in items like spawn eggs, mob buckets, paintings, item frames, etc. These components modify some of the properties of the entity stored within those items.

Here is a list of all entity variant components:

== Non-encoded components ==
These data components exist and are used by the game internally, but are not encoded on items. Therefore, they cannot be used in commands, nor seen with {{command|data}}.

=== creative_slot_lock ===

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
** {{nbt|compound|minecraft:creative_slot_lock}}: Only used internally to lock the informational [[paper]] items in the [[creative inventory]]. If set, this item cannot be taken out of its slot.
</div>

=== map_post_processing ===

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
** {{nbt|int|minecraft:map_post_processing}}: Only used internally when this [[filled map]] has been duplicated or locked in a [[crafting table]] or a [[cartography table]]. Can be 0 (lock) or 1 (scale), adding the "Locked" line or "Scale" line in this item's tooltip, respectively.
</div>

=== additional_trade_cost ===
{{in development|java||26.1|section=1}}
<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
** {{nbt|int|minecraft:additional_trade_cost}}: Used on the {{cd|gives}} item of a [[villager trade definition|villager trade]] to add to the {{cd|count}} of the {{cd|wants}} item.
</div>

== Exclusive to joke versions ==
The following components were added and used in [[April Fools' Day jokes|April Fools' Day joke]] snapshots.

=== [[24w14potato]] ===

{{Collapse|title=List of the components|head=1}}
==== clicks ====

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
** {{nbt|int|minecraft:clicks}}: The number of times this [[poisonous potato plant]] has been clicked in the inventory.
</div>

==== contacts_messages ====

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
** {{nbt|long-array|minecraft:contacts_messages}}: Used by the [[poisonous potato plant]].
</div>

<div class="treeview">

** {{nbt|boolean|minecraft:explicit_foil}}: Whether or not this item should display a glint.
</div>

==== fletching ====

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
** {{nbt|compound|minecraft:fletching}}: Information about this [[fletching table]].
*** {{nbt|string|quality}}: A single character defining the quality of this block.
*** {{nbt|string|impurities}}: A single character defining the impurity of this block.
*** {{nbt|string|next_level_impurities}}: A single character defining the impurity of the next level of this block.
*** {{nbt|short|processs_time}}{{sic}}: The process time of this block, in ticks.
*** {{nbt|boolean|explored}}: Whether this block has been explored.
</div>

==== heat ====

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
** {{nbt|compound|minecraft:heat}}: Information about this [[hot potato]].
*** {{nbt|int|heat}}: The amount of heat. Has a maximum value of 200.
*** {{nbt|int|slot}}: The inventory slot this item is in.
*** {{nbt|int-array|owner}}: The UUID of the entity currently holding this item.
</div>

==== hovered ====

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
** {{nbt|boolean|minecraft:hovered}}: Whether or not this [[poisonous potato plant]] is the last item stack hovered in the inventory.

** {{nbt|compound|minecraft:lubrication}}

==== potato_bane ====

*** {{nbt|string|impurities}}: A single character defining the impurity of this item. Used to prefix the "Impurities" line on the tooltip.
</div>

=== [[25w14craftmine]] ===

{{Collapse|title=List of the components|head=1}}
==== dimension_id ====

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
** {{nbt|string|minecraft:dimension_id}}: The resource location of the dimension this [[Mine (item)|mine]] item will teleport the player to when placed on a [[mine revisitor]] and used.
</div>

==== exchange_value ====

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
** {{nbt|float|minecraft:exchange_value}}: The value of the item, which is used to determine how much experience the player gains from it when exiting a mine.
</div>

==== instant_room ====

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
** {{nbt|compound|minecraft:instant_room}}: The room this [[shimmering key]] opens.
*** {{nbt|string|structure}}: The resource location of the structure. The key can only open a room if a structure file with the specified name exists inside the {{cd|hub/room/}} folder under the specified namespace in a [[data pack]].
</div>

==== mine_active ====

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
** {{nbt|compound|minecraft:mine_active}}: Is set on the [[Mine (item)|mine]] item in the [[mine crafter]] when the player is inside a mine.
</div>

==== mine_completed ====

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
** {{nbt|boolean|minecraft:mine_completed}}: Whether the mine this [[Mine (item)|mine]] item refers to was completed. Determines the color of the glint on the item (green if completed, red if failed).
</div>

==== mob_trophy/type ====

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
** {{nbt|compound|minecraft:mob_trophy/type}}: Information about this [[mob trophy]].
*** {{nbt|boolean|shiny}}: Whether the mob inside this mob trophy has an enchantment glint on it. Also adds the text "Oooh, shiny!" to the tooltip.
*** {{nbt|string|type}}: The resource location for the entity type inside this mob trophy.
</div>

==== sky ====

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
** {{nbt|compound|minecraft:sky}}: Information about this [[sky box]].
*** {{nbt|string|type}}: The type of sky that [[Sky (block)|sky]] blocks render. Must be one of {{cd|overworld}}, {{cd|end}}, {{cd|cube}}, {{cd|panorama}}, {{cd|code}}.
*** If the value is {{cd|cube}}, there are additional fields that are required:
*** {{nbt|string|texture}}: A resource location pointing to a texture asset.
*** {{nbt|int|repeats}}: The number of times the texture will be tiled horizontally and vertically on each plane of the cube.
*** {{nbt|float|size}}: Is set to 400.0 for [[sky box]]es in the boiler room.{{more info needed|this doesn't look like it changes anything}}
*** {{nbt|string}}{{nbt|list}}{{nbt|compound|name}}: A text component that will be shown as the name of the sky in the "Sky:" line of the tooltip.
</div>

==== special_mine ====

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
** {{nbt|string|minecraft:special_mine}}: The resource location of the special mine this [[Mine (item)|mine]] item teleports the player to.
</div>

==== trophy/type ====

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
** {{nbt|string|minecraft:trophy/type}}: The type of this [[Trophy (April Fools' joke)|trophy]]. Must be one of {{cd|gold}}, {{cd|mega_spud}}, {{cd|no_medal}}.
</div>

<div class="treeview">
* {{nbt|compound|components}}: Parent tag.
** {{nbt|compound|minecraft:world_modifiers}}: The [[mine ingredient]]s included in the mine this [[Mine (item)|mine]] item teleports the player to.
*** {{nbt|list|effects}}: List of resource locations of world modifiers included in the mine.
**** {{nbt|string}}: A world modifier.
*** {{nbt|boolean|include_description}}: Whether to show the mine ingredients in the tooltip of this mine item.

== History ==
{{HistoryTable
|{{HistoryLine|java}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.20.5|dev=24w09a|Replaced {{nbt|compound|tag}} tag and all underlying item-specific tags with data components.
|Replaced {{nbt|byte|Count}} with {{nbt|int|count}}.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=24w10a|Renamed {{cd|lodestone_target}} component to {{cd|lodestone_tracker}}, and moved {{nbt|int-array|pos}} and {{nbt|string|dimension}} fields to {{nbt|compound|target}}.
|{{cd|d=and|profile|dyed_color|attribute_modifiers|potion_contents|enchantments|stored_enchantments}} components can now optionally be defined in simpler formats.
|{{cd|lore}} and {{cd|fireworks}} components now allow up to 256 entries in their list.
|{{cd|container}} component now applies to all [[container]]s, instead of only [[shulker box]]es.
|{{nbt|string|name}} is no longer required in {{cd|profile}} component.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=24w12a|Added {{cd|d=and|food|max_stack_size|max_damage|fire_resistant|rarity|tool|hide_tooltip}} components.
|The old <code>{...}</code> item format has been removed, and can no longer be used as a shortcut for {{cd|custom_data}} component.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=24w13a|Added {{cd|d=and|item_name|ominous_bottle_amplifier}} components.
|Components with non-default values on block items are now stored on block entities when placed.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=24w14a|Renamed {{nbt|string|text}} to {{nbt|string|raw}} in {{cd|d=and|writable_book_content|written_book_content}} components.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=Pre-Release 1|Renamed {{nbt|float|saturation_modifier}} to {{nbt|float|saturation}} in {{cd|food}} component.
|{{cd|d=and|max_damage|max_stack_size}} components can no longer be put together.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.21|dev=24w19a|{{cd|custom_data}} component can now be defined as a SNBT string.
|Added {{nbt|compound|using_converts_to}} in {{cd|food}} component.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=24w21a|Added {{cd|jukebox_playable}} component.
|Changed {{cd|attribute_modifiers}} component: removed {{nbt|string|name}} and {{nbt|int-array|uuid}} fields, added {{nbt|string|id}} field.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.21.2|dev=24w33a|Added <code>repairable</code> and <code>enchantable</code> components.
|The title specified in the <code>written_book_content</code> component is now prioritized over <code>custom_name</code> and <code>item_name</code> for any item with a non-empty title in this component.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=24w34a|Added <code>consumable</code>, <code>use_cooldown</code> and <code>use_remainder</code> components.
|The <code>food</code> component has been changed to become a data container that holds only the food stats applied when the item is consumed. The component no longer gives the item the ability to be consumed. Removed the {{nbt|float|eat_seconds}}, {{nbt|compound|using_converts_to}} and {{nbt|list|effects}} fields from <code>food</code>.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=24w36a|Added <code>equippable</code>, <code>item_model</code>, <code>glider</code> and <code>tooltip_style</code> components.
|The <code>item_name</code> component is now always present on every item.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=24w37a|Added <code>death_protection</code> component.
|Renamed <code>fire_resistant</code> component to <code>damage_resistant</code>, and added {{nbt|string|types}} field.
|The name provided by the <code>item_name</code> component now always has the lowest priority.
|Added {{nbt|string|custom_name}} in <code>potion_contents</code> component.
|Added {{nbt|boolean|swappable}} and {{nbt|boolean|damage_on_hurt}} in <code>equippable</code> component.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=24w39a|The <code>lock</code> component is now a compound that represents an item predicate.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=Pre-Release 1|Added {{nbt|string|camera_overlay}} in <code>equippable</code> component.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.21.4|dev=24w45a|{{cd|custom_model_data}} now has more fields to accommodate new uses by various model property getters: {{cd|floats}}, {{cd|flags}}, {{cd|strings}} and {{cd|colors}}.
|{{cd|item_model}} now uses {{cd|assets/[namespace]/items/}}, rather than {{cd|assets/[namespace]/models/item}}.
|The {{cd|equippable}} component had its field {{cd|model}} renamed to {{cd|asset_id}}.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.21.5|dev=25w02a|Added <code>weapon</code> and <code>potion_duration_scale</code> components.
|Added new optional field {{nbt|bool|can_destroy_blocks_in_creative}} to {{cd|tool}} component.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=25w03a|{{nbt|int|damage_per_attack}} field in {{cd|weapon}} component was renamed to {{nbt|int|item_damage_per_attack}}
|{{cd|equippable}} component can now apply to saddle slot, and has a new optional field: {{nbt|boolean|equip_on_interact}}.
|Added 21 components, all of which are entity variant components.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=25w04a|Added the {{cd|blocks_attacks}}, {{cd|break_sound}}, {{cd|provides_banner_patterns}}, {{cd|provides_trim_material}} and {{cd|tooltip_display}} components.
|Removed the {{cd|hide_tooltip}} and {{cd|hide_additional_tooltip}} components in favor of the new {{cd|tooltip_display}} component.
|Removed the {{nbt|boolean|show_in_tooltip}} field from all components that previously had it in favor of the new {{cd|tooltip_display}} component.
|{{nbt|boolean|can_disable_blocking}} field in {{cd|weapon}} component was renamed to {{nbt|float|disable_blocking_for_seconds}}.
|Most components that used to have two fields (one of them being the {{nbt|boolean|show_in_tooltip}} field) now always use their simplified form, with the other one field inlined to top-level. For example: {{cd|<nowiki>enchantments={levels:{sharpness:2}}</nowiki>}} -> {{cd|<nowiki> enchantments={sharpness:2}</nowiki>}}}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=25w05a|Added {{nbt|string|bypassed_by}} field to {{cd|blocks_attacks}} component.
|Added {{nbt|float|horizontal_blocking_angle}} field to objects within {{nbt|list|damage_reduction}} field to {{cd|blocks_attacks}} component.
|Added {{cd|cow/variant}} entity variant component.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=25w06a|Added {{cd|chicken/variant}} entity variant component.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=25w08a|Added {{cd|wolf/sound_variant}} entity variant component.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.21.6|dev=25w15a|Added optional {{nbt|compound|display}} field to {{cd|attributes_modifiers}}.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=25w16a|The {{cd|painting/variant}} component no longer allows inline paining variant definitions.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=25w20a|Added optional {{nbt|bool|can_be_sheared}} and {{nbt|string}}{{nbt|compound|shearing_sound}} fields to {{cd|equippable}}.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.21.9|dev=25w34a|Player profiles in data components and block entities no longer resolve automatically.
|The <code>minecraft:profile</code> component has now two behaviors, Static or Dynamic, depending on which fields are specified.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=Pre-Release 1|{{cd|minecraft:profile}}: Profiles can now also have additional fields that can replace various values used for rendering; if any of the fields are omitted, the value from the resolved profile is used, even if the profile resolved to the default skin.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.21.11|dev=25w41a|Added {{cd|minecraft:damage_type}}, {{cd|minecraft:kinetic_weapon}}, {{cd|minecraft:minimum_attack_charge}}, {{cd|minecraft:piercing_weapon}}, {{cd|minecraft:swing_animation}} and {{cd|minecraft:use_effects}} item components.
|{{cd|minecraft:consumable}}: The animation field has been updated.
|{{cd|minecraft:intangible}}: Items with this component now show information about it in their tooltip.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=25w42a|{{cd|minecraft:kinetic_weapon}}: Added new field, {{cd|contact_cooldown_ticks}}.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=25w45a|{{cd|minecraft:piercing_weapon}} and {{cd|minecraft:kinetic_weapon}} data components now have bounds on their reach parameters.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=25w46a|Added food properties to the following fish bucket items: {{cd|minecraft:cod_bucket}}, {{cd|minecraft:salmon_bucket}}, {{cd|minecraft:pufferfish_bucket}}, and {{cd|minecraft:tropical_fish_bucket}}.|{{cd|minecraft:use_effects}}: added field {{cd|interact_vibrations}}.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=pre1|{{cd|min_reach}}, {{cd|max_reach}} and {{cd|hitbox_margin}} have been moved from {{cd|minecraft:piercing_weapon}} and {{cd|minecraft:kinetic_weapon}} into a new component {{cd|minecraft:attack_range}} to allow all melee weapon types to use them.}}
|{{HistoryLine|||dev=pre4|{{cd|minecraft:attack_range}}: Added fields {{cd|min_creative_reach}} and {{cd|max_creative_reach}}.}}
|{{HistoryLine|upcoming java}}
|{{HistoryLine||26.1|dev=snap1|Added {{cd|minecraft:additional_trade_cost}}.}}
}}
